perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees that it will publish such results as promptly as practicable following the Merger in the sole discretion of PSS, but in any event within 45 days after the end of the first fiscal quarter of PSS containing the required period of post-Merger combined operations and that it will notify the undersigned promptly following such publication.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS agrees that it will publish such results at its convenience with no set deadline following the Merger and will notify the undersigned at its convenience, if at all.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific deadline (45 days after the end of the first fiscal quarter) for publishing financial results, giving PSS complete discretion over the timing and potentially delaying or avoiding publication altogether. This conflicts with SEC regulations requiring timely and accurate financial reporting.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations regarding timely financial reporting, specifically related to post-merger combined operations.

perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees, for a period of three years after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS is not obligated to file any reports after the effective date of the Merger. The filing of any report is at the sole discretion of PSS.
perturbation.explanation: This modification eliminates PSS's obligation to file reports required under Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, contradicting securities laws which mandate regular financial disclosures by public companies. It affects the affiliate's ability to sell shares under Rule 145(d).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC.

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned further recognizes that, in the event that the undersigned is a director or officer of PSS or becomes a director or officer of PSS upon consummation of the Merger, among other things, any sale of PSS Common Stock by the undersigned within a period of less than six months following the effective time of the Merger may subject the undersigned to liability pursuant to Section 16(b) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned further recognizes that any sale of PSS Common Stock is permissible at any time following the effective time of the Merger regardless of whether the undersigned is a director or officer of PSS.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts Section 16(b) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the 'short-swing profit rule'), which prevents insiders (directors, officers, and beneficial owners) from profiting from purchases and sales of their company's stock within a six-month period. The modified text suggests that such sales are permissible regardless of the insider status or the holding period, directly violating federal securities law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 16(b) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
